entries.title: Bank of Canada Cuts Rates to Become First G-7 Central Bank to Ease Policy
entries.description: The Bank of Canada cut its main interest rate by a quarter percentage point, becoming the first Group of Seven central bank to provide rate relief after global policymakers aggressively increased borrowing costs to tame inflation.

entries.title: Modi Now Has to Figure Out a New Way to Rule India
entries.description: Stripped of his strong majority, India’s prime minister will need the help of allied parties to push through his economic agenda.

entries.title: Hanesbrands to Sell Champion Brand for Up to $1.5 Billion
entries.description: Clothing company to focus on its underwear brands, which include Hanes, Bonds, Maidenform and Bali.

entries.title: The Sports League That Overturned Instant Replay
entries.description: Soccer fans in Sweden saw the way video replay was used in other leagues and successfully campaigned to block it. Now others, like the English Premier League, could follow suit.

entries.title: Diddy's Empire Is Crumbling. The Warning Signs Were There All Along.
entries.description: Sean Combs harnessed his bad boy image to transform the way music stars do business. Allegations of rape, forced drugging and sexual harassment have shattered his legacy.

entries.title: How to Eat Your Way to a Greener Planet
entries.description: Growing food creates about one-third of the total greenhouse-gas emissions produced by society. Here are food options that don’t break the bank when it comes to carbon emissions.

entries.title: How to Keep Your Car From Spying on You
entries.description: New features on cars and phone apps can track where you go, when and how fast—among many other things. Here’s what to do about it.

entries.title: Even Hardened Convicts Are No Match for These Guard Geese
entries.description: Dogs napped too much and were susceptible to bribes, so the warden of a Brazilian prison turned to feathered allies to prevent escapes.

entries.title: U.S. Stocks Trade Higher
entries.description: The S&P 500, Dow industrials and Nasdaq Composite all rose, with the latter leading the pack. Shares of CrowdStrike and Hewlett Packard Enterprise rallied.

entries.title: Watch Live: Boeing's Starliner Launch
entries.description: Watch live coverage of NASA’s Boeing Starliner crewed flight test, with astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, to the International Space Station.

entries.title: The Morning Risk Report
entries.description: AI employees fear they aren’t free to voice their concerns, and U.S. prosecutors probe a global hacking-for-hire operation. Also, the SEC is closing its Salt Lake City office after failed crypto case against Debt Box.

entries.title: Estée Lauder's Board Plans to Keep Its Longtime CEO
entries.description: Fabrizio Freda is expected to remain in the top job at the beauty giant despite its sagging performance and division in the founding family over direction.

entries.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Are Higher in Early Trade
entries.description: Natural gas futures rose after yesterday’s pullback. On the bearish side are pipeline issues being resolved and still large inventories, while summer heat and strong LNG demand are bullish.

entries.title: Here's a Tax Break That Married Couples Often Overlook
entries.description: Spousal IRAs could help many couples increase their retirement savings.

entries.title: Google Parent Alphabet Poaches Eli Lilly Finance Chief Ashkenazi
entries.description: Google parent Alphabet has named Anat Ashkenazi as its next finance chief officer, plucking the executive from drugmaker Eli Lilly.

entries.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Hewlett Packard, CrowdStrike and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

entries.title: Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Shell and BP and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.

entries.title: NBA Nears $76 Billion TV Deal, a Defining Moment for Media and Sports
entries.description: The league is closing in on deals with NBC, ESPN and Amazon that would bring in about $76 billion in media revenue over 11 years.

entries.title: Auto & Transport Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Stellantis, Maersk and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Auto and Transport sector.

entries.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Swiss Re and Munich Re and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.
